properties.areaDesc: South Central Oregon Coast; Curry County Coast
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 2 at 6:26PM PST until February 4 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Increased threat for dangerous sneaker waves is
expected.

* WHERE...Beaches of Douglas, Coos, and Curry counties.

* WHEN...From late Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening.

* IMPACTS...Sneaker waves with high run-ups can knock unsuspecting
people over and drag them out to sea. Shock and hypothermia can
occur quickly in the cold Pacific waters. Logs and other debris
can be lifted and floated by these waves, crushing or entrapping
unsuspecting victims underneath. Never turn your back to the
ocean.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
A Beach Hazards Statement is issued when threats such as rip
currents...longshore currents...sneaker waves and other hazards
create life-threatening conditions in the surf zone. Caution
should be used when in or near the water. Stay off of beaches,
rocks, jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
